main event: On October 15, 1952, civilian witnesses reported seeing two bright lights northeast on Mt. 4.5-45 miles away in Palmer, Alaska. The lights were described as drifting down the mountain, golden in color, and then going away. The object then drifted up the river one mile and rose out of sight.
interesting points: There was no photograph of the observed objects.
Physical evidence was available, indicating a potentially significant incident.
The report was filed under G-2 Alert #133 and was considered of possible significance but insufficient for sound conclusions.
The object description provided by civilian witnesses was deemed insufficient for sound conclusions.
sighted object: two bright lights drifting down a mountain in Palmer, Alaska
